text: Homeland (Domovina) was an electoral alliance in Republika Srpska, forming a joint parliamentary group in the National Assembly. The alliance was formed to contest the elections in Republika Srpska, and consists of the Democratic Front, the Union for a Better Future of BiH, the Party of Democratic Action, the Party for Bosnia and Herzegovina, the Croatian Party of Rights, the Diaspora Party of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the Posavina Party.When bullets decide politics Today's Zaman, 4 July 2014 In the elections in 2014 the alliance received 5.3% of the vote, winning five seats in the National Assembly.Republika Srpska National Assembly Central Elections Commission ==Member parties== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" | Name ! width=60px| Abbr. ! width=120px| Leader ! width=100px| Position ! width=60px| Ideology ! width=80px| |- | style="background-color: " | | | SDA | Bakir Izetbegović | Centre-right | Conservatism | |- | style="background-color: " | | Union for a Better Future | SBB | Fahrudin Radončić | Centre-right | Conservatism | |- | style="background-color: " | | Croatian Party of Rights Hrvatska stranka prava | HSP | Stanko Primorac | Far-right | Neo-fascism | |- | width=5px style="background:orange;" | | Democratic Front Demokratska fronta | DF | Željko Komšić | Centre-left | Social democracy | |- |style="background-color: " | | Stranka za Bosnu i Hercegovinu |SzBiH |Amer Jerlagić |Right-wing |Bosniak nationalism | |} ==References== Category:Political party alliances in Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Political parties in Republika Srpska
title: Homeland (political alliance)
